items.name: 1033-native BaaS compliance layer for regional banks
items.why_now: CFPB 1033 April 2026+ rollout; BaaS partner oversight tightening via consent orders; regional banks below $250B need compliant data APIs before 2027–2030 deadlines. Plaid/Yodlee aggregating; gap is bank-owned or white-label 1033 readiness.
items.description: B2B SaaS that bundles 1033 consumer consent UX + secure API aggregation for regional banks and credit unions. Sell as "1033 readiness" to institutions approaching 2027–2030 compliance. Target: US banks $10B–$250B assets.

items.name: EU AI Act compliance platform for fintech
items.why_now: EU AI Act obligations begin 2025 (general-purpose) and 2026 (high-risk); 70% of fintech report 5%+ revenue from AI; compliance shifting from cost center to growth function. No single vendor owns AI compliance for mid-market fintech.
items.description: Vertical SaaS for EU-touching fintech: risk assessments, documentation, monitoring for AI systems. Target mid-market fintech (€50M–€500M AUM) lacking in-house AI governance. Price €50K–150K/year.

items.name: AI vendor evaluation platform for enterprise buyers
items.why_now: AI chatbots are #1 vendor shortlist source (17.1%); 88% power users pay premium for AI; IT participation in purchases at 50%. Buying committees shrinking to 3–4; no structured way to evaluate AI vendors against security/compliance.
items.description: B2B platform that helps procurement/IT evaluate AI software vendors: security, compliance, ROI evidence. Integrates with AI search and review sites. Target: enterprises with 10–50 software purchases/year.
